AbstractText: 通过开顶箱(OTCs)模拟,以环境臭氧(O<sub>3</sub>)浓度约40 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>为对照,研究大气O<sub>3</sub>浓度升高(80和160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>O<sub>3</sub>)对冷季型草坪草高羊茅生长、亚细胞结构及其活性氧代谢的影响.结果表明: 14 d的80 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>O<sub>3</sub>熏蒸使高羊茅株高和叶宽降低,总生物量降低43.7%,老叶变黄,而160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>O<sub>3</sub>处理高羊茅叶出现大量枯死褐斑,叶尖坏死,新叶卷曲,总生物量降低46.2%,叶肉细胞膜卷曲,叶绿体和线粒体受损严重.与对照相比,80和160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>O<sub>3</sub>熏蒸下高羊茅叶片超氧阴离子(O<sub>2</sub><sup>-·</sup>)产生速率、过氧化氢(H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>)和丙二醛(MDA)含量显著增加,抗氧化酶活性显著升高,但叶片总酚含量和抗氧化能力随O<sub>3</sub>浓度升高而先升高后降低.在明显O<sub>3</sub>伤害症状出现之前,O<sub>3</sub>已对高羊茅的生长和抗氧化代谢产生不利影响;高羊茅抗氧化系统虽对O<sub>3</sub>浓度的升高存在一定的适应性反应,但其不能抵御过高浓度的长期胁迫和伤害.

Journal.Title: Ying yong sheng tai xue bao = The journal of applied ecology
Journal.ISOAbbreviation: Ying Yong Sheng Tai Xue Bao

Article.ArticleTitle: [Effects of increased O<sub>3</sub> concentration on growth, subcellular structure and reactive oxygen metabolism of turf-type Festuca arundinace].

AbstractText: Taking ambient environmental O<sub>3</sub>(40 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>) as control, the study was conducted to assess the impact of elevated O<sub>3</sub>(80 and 160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>) on the growth, subcellular structure and reactive oxygen metabolism of turf-type Festuca arundinace in open top-chambers (OTCs). The results showed that under 14-day fumigation, the height and leaf width of F. arundinace decreased significantly, and the total biomass decreased by 43.7%, and some fully expanded leaves yellowed under 80 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup> O<sub>3</sub>. Some visible injury symptoms, brown spots and necrosis appeared in the leaves, the total biomass decreased by 46.2%, and plasma membrane became loose from the cell wall and convoluted, chloroplast and mitochondria were damaged under 160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup> O<sub>3</sub>. The rate of superoxide anion (O<sub>2</sub><sup>-·</sup>) production, hydrogen peroxide (H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>) content, malonaldehyde (MDA) content and the activities of antioxidant enzymes were higher under the increasing O<sub>3</sub> concentrations (80 and 160 nmol·mol<sup>-1</sup>) compared with control. Total phenolics and the antioxidant capacity increased at first and then decreased with the rise of O<sub>3</sub> concentration. It indicated that O<sub>3</sub> has already affected F. arundinace growth and antioxidative metabolism before visible injury symptom appeared. F. arundinace had an adaptive response to elevated O<sub>3</sub>, but it could not protect itself from excessive O<sub>3</sub> or long-term O<sub>3</sub> exposure.
